name: SelectScrollDownArrow
description:
An element that scrolls the select popup down when hovered. Does not render when using touch input.
Renders a `<div>` element.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

style.detailedType:
| React.CSSProperties
| ((
    state: Select.ScrollDownArrow.State,
  ) => CSSProperties | undefined)
| undefined

keepMounted.description: Whether to keep the HTML element in the DOM while the select popup is not scrollable.

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: Select.ScrollDownArrow.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-direction.description: Indicates the direction of the scroll arrow.

data-side.description: Indicates which side the popup is positioned relative to the trigger.

data-visible.description: Present when the scroll arrow is visible.

data-starting-style.description: Present when the scroll arrow is animating in.

data-ending-style.description: Present when the scroll arrow is animating out.
